Class Key

java.lang.Object
  Key

public class Key
extends Object

Key

Defines the Key of the song, with methods to analyze Chords, scales, Notes, etc. using the Key's information

Version:
3.0
Author:
Devon Hubert

Constructor Summary
Key()
          The default constructor, which sets the Key to C Major
Key(int keyValue, boolean isMajor)
          The constructor that accepts a keyValue (a number representing the number of sharps/flats in the Key), and a variable for whether or not it is a Major or minor key
Key(String keyName, boolean isMajor)
           
 
Method Summary
 void addFlats(int num)
          Adds flats to the Key in the order designated by the circle of fifths, and adjusts the Key's keyValue accordingly

          Adds sharps to the Key in the order designated by the circle of fifths, and adjusts the Key's keyValue accordingly

Constructor Detail

Key

public Key()
The default constructor, which sets the Key to C Major

Key

public Key(int keyValue,
           boolean isMajor)
The constructor that accepts a keyValue (a number representing the number of sharps/flats in the Key), and a variable for whether or not it is a Major or minor key

Parameters:
keyValue - The integer value of the Key, representing the totals number of sharps and flats int the Key (each flat subtracts 1 from the value, and each flat adds 1)
isMajor - A boolean value that returns true if the Key is Major

Key

public Key(String keyName,
           boolean isMajor)
Method Detail

addFlats

public void addFlats(int num)
Adds flats to the Key in the order designated by the circle of fifths, and adjusts the Key's keyValue accordingly

Parameters:
num - The number of flats to add

addSharps

public void addSharps(int num)
Adds sharps to the Key in the order designated by the circle of fifths, and adjusts the Key's keyValue accordingly

Parameters:
num - The number of sharps to add

analyze

public ArrayList<Chord> analyze(ArrayList<Chord> chordList)
Analyzes the given list of Chords by finding each Chord's Note name

Parameters:
chordList - The list of Chords to be analyzed
Returns:
the analyzed list

arrangeScale

public Note[] arrangeScale(Note[] scale,
                           String rootName)
Arranges the set of notes in the key into a scale, starting on the given root. This can also be used to generate "modes," and other modal scales

Parameters:
scale - An array of Notes to be re-arranged into the new scale
rootName - The name of the desired root (starting note), around which the new scale will be based
Returns:
the new scale, starting on the given root

findMajorKeyName

public String findMajorKeyName(int keyValue)
Finds the Key's name, given that the Key is Major

Parameters:
keyValue - The integer value that represents the desired Key
Returns:
the String representing the resulting Major key

Overrides:

turnToParallelMode

public Note[] turnToParallelMode(String scaleType)
Finds the mode of given scaleType ("Ionian", "Dorian", etc.) with the same root name as the Major scale based off of the current Key

Parameters:
scaleType - The type of scale desired ("Ionian", "Dorian", etc.)
Returns:
an array of Notes in the new mode
